title: How many battles did Napoleon fight? - Quora

response.answer_text: Napoleon bonaparte was short man with bigger ambition. He was the emperor of France. He was not born in Royal family but a product of 1789 French revolution. Napoleon was born in modest family. He was artillery officer in French army. He rose to higher ranks very quickly during the time of French revolution. Napoleon fought many battles in his life. His first campaign was against Austria and Italy. Then he led his army in Egypt. After he become emperor napoleon defeted the coalition of Austria Russia in battle of austerlitz and ended the roman empire. Napoleon was a military genius. He ruled and dominated the Europe for a decade. He fought many wars during 1803–1815 and won most of the battles. These wars are known as napoleonic wars. In 1812 he invaded Russia. Austria and prussia formed a coalition with Russia against napoleon. This coalition was backed by British empire. After series of many battles they decisively defeted French in battle of leipzig. This was first time when napoleon tasted defeat and forced to withdraw his grand army. Napoleon went to exile in Elba but soon after he regained control of France. But the coalition invaded France and defeted napoleon in historic battle of Waterloo in 1815. This was the end of the legendary napoleon. He was exiled to island of Saint helena. He died in 1821 during his captivity. British captives buried him on same island against napoleon’s will. In his will he had asked to buried on banks of seine river of France. You can not count exact number of wars fought by napoleon. Napoleon got involved in wars from his early career in army to the end of his empire in 1815. His battle tactics were enormously analysed by historian. Indeed napoleon was a military genius and national hero at his peak.

There were seven Wars of the Coalition. The first war was waged against the revolutionary government of the First Republic. The second was waged against the Directory, the government of France at the time the war broke out. Napoleon took power in the Brumaire Coup in November, 1799, and therefore, the War of the Second Coalition was partly a Napoleonic war. The five subsequent wars of the Coalition were all waged against Napoleon. So one could say there were five Napoleonic wars, or five and a half, or six, depending on how one chooses to do the counting. You can read about the Wars of the Coalition by visiting this site: Coalitions Against France Note that under each rubric, there is a “clickable” link for the high points of each coalition war. Note also that Napoleon summoned Ferdinand VII of Spain to France in 1808, informed him that he was deposed, and then invaded Spain to put his brother Joseph on the throne in Madrid.
